Package org.bonitasoft.engine.search

Class SearchOptionsBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.bonitasoft.engine.search.SearchOptionsBuilder
public class SearchOptionsBuilder extends Object
Builder for SearchOptions objects. It can be used to define paged searches returning SearchResults. When several filters are added, implicit AND operators are used if not specified. See SearchOptions for deeper details on search mechanism options.
Author:
Matthieu Chaffotte, Emmanuel Duchastenier, Celine Souchet

  • Constructor Details

    • SearchOptionsBuilder

      public SearchOptionsBuilder(int startIndex, int maxResults)
      Builds a new SearchOptions with results limited to startIndex and maxResults. If you are interested only in the number of elements matching with the given criteria without knowing the elements details, it's possible to use 0 (zero) as maxResults: SearchResult.getResult() will send an empty list and SearchResult.getCount() will return the number of matching elements.
      Parameters:
      startIndex - the first result to return
      maxResults - the maximum results to return. The actual number can be smaller, if the end of the list has been reached. If 0 (zero) or a negative number is provided, only the result count will be pertinent, and the result list itself will be empty.
      See Also:
      • SearchOptions
      • SearchResult.getResult()
      • SearchResult.getCount()

    • SearchOptionsBuilder

  • Method Details

    • filter

      public SearchOptionsBuilder filter(String field, Serializable value)
      Filter the results to the specific value for the specific field (equality)
      Parameters:
      field - The name of the field to filter on. Depending on the search parameter, specify the field by accessing the relevant xxxSearchDescriptor classes. For example, HumanTaskInstanceSearchDescriptor.NAME and HumanTaskInstanceSearchDescriptor.PROCESS_DEFINITION_ID.
      value - the single value to filter on that field name
      Returns:
      this builder itself
      Since:
      6.0

      Parameters:

      value - the value to compare.
      Returns:
